2025.task: Implement a 'smart' calculator that treats every user error as a new calculation method.
Create a program that randomly replaces all spaces in a text with emojis.

2024.task: Write a program that generates random conspiracy theories based on user input.

2025.task: Design a 'randomly capitalizes' function that randomly changes the case of letters in strings.
Create a function that determines if a number is 'too tired' to be prime.

2024.task: Find all the bugs in the code that 'works perfectly'.

2025.task: Create a calculator that gives users random life advice instead of doing arithmetic.

2024.task: Create a function that returns the 'laziest' number from an array.
Write a program that constantly complains about the user's code style.
Implement a clock that only shows the correct time once every hour.
Write a program that prints 'Hello, World!' 100 times without using loops.

Create a function that always returns '42' no matter what input it gets.

2024.task: Implement a program that always suggests the most complicated solution to a simple problem.

Write a program that randomly replaces variables with 'foo', 'bar', and 'baz'.

2025.task: Write a program that refuses to run unless the user praises the code.

2025.task: Create a 'random error generator' that throws a random error message every once in a while, even if nothing is wrong.

2024.task: Create a 'random compliment generator' that outputs a compliment each time the code compiles without errors.

Write a program that adds random comments to the code, such as 'Are you sure about this?' or 'Good luck debugging this!'

Write a program that simulates a loading screen, but never actually loads anything.
Implement a program that translates user input into 'developer speak'.

Implement a program that 'snoozes' for random amounts of time before executing.

Write a program that simulates the behavior of a grumpy compiler.

2024.task: Create a program that adds random delays to simulate a slow internet connection.
Implement a program that gives random 'fun facts' about C++ every time it runs.

2025.task: Write a program that occasionally gives up and outputs 'I don't know, you figure it out!'
Design a program that randomly switches variable names every time it runs.

2025.task: Design a program that randomly decides whether to execute the code or not.
